meanings.definition: A government program that provides welfare recipients with work in exchange for benefits.
meanings.sent1: The workfare program helped people find jobs.
meanings.sent2: She joined the workfare initiative to earn her benefits.
meanings.sent3: The workfare scheme made sure everyone had a job to do.
meanings.sent4: In the world of workfare, everyone pitches in to earn their keep.
meanings.sent5: Participating in workfare meant working for what you received.

meanings.definition: The system of providing welfare recipients with employment opportunities in order to receive benefits.
meanings.sent1: Workfare aims to help those in need by offering job opportunities.
meanings.sent2: Many people have benefited from the workfare system.
meanings.sent3: The workfare setup turned welfare into a chance for employment.
meanings.sent4: She saw the workfare program as a bridge to a better future.
meanings.sent5: Engaging in workfare meant taking steps towards self-sufficiency.
